meanings.definition: A substance found in cell nuclei.
meanings.sent1: Scientists study nucleins to learn more about cell structures.
meanings.sent2: The nucleins in the nucleus contain important genetic information.
meanings.sent3: The nucleins in the cell nucleus were having a party, but the mitochondria were not invited.
meanings.sent4: Her love for biology was like the nucleins in a cell, essential and foundational.
meanings.sent5: Under the microscope, the nucleins appeared like tiny, intricate threads holding the cell together.

meanings.definition: A type of protein found in the nucleus of a cell.
meanings.sent1: The nucleins play a crucial role in regulating cell functions.
meanings.sent2: Proteins like nucleins help maintain the structure of the nucleus.
meanings.sent3: The nucleins in the cell nucleus were chatting about their favorite amino acids.
meanings.sent4: Her dedication to her work was as strong as the nucleins that support the nucleus.
meanings.sent5: The nucleins, like tiny workers, diligently carry out their tasks within the cell.
